Participants will develop core competences, orient in a foreign work environment and increase their mobility. They will improve English and increase their interest in a foreign language study. Internship will also affect participants´ personal life. Participants will strengthen their adaptability, flexibility and autonomy.
Our school will involve in the partnership cooperation. We will become acquainted with the situation and trends in handicraft abroad. We will win a unique foreign know-how in the field of craftsmanship and we will disseminate it in the Czech Republic. We will also win suggestions for the improvement of teaching of vocational subjects and English. The project will contribute to the growth of the reputation of our school and will raise interest in the handicraft disciplines.
In the European context, the project is important for its impact on development and transfer of experiences in the unique fields of handicraft. It contributes to the support and promotion of handicrafts. From a wider perspective, the project will be reflected in the development of European cooperation, the promotion of the growth of knowledge of foreign languages, the development of working mobility and intercultural awareness. The impact will also be on the use of European tools for the creation and recognition of qualifications (ECVET and Europass). Its implementation will contribute to enhancing the transparency, clarity and eligibility of qualifications in the fields of handicrafts.

The project builds on our successfully implemented mobility projects from previous years. It is based on the efforts to fulfil our European development plan in the development of international cooperation and improvement of the quality of provided education. The reason for the project implementation is also endeavour to respond to the demands of employers. Employers place great emphasis on work experience gained, good knowledge of at least one foreign language and key competencies of graduates. Finally, the implementation of the project is matter of prestige for our school and tool how to strengthen the position of the school in our region and increasing the attractiveness of the study.
The project will enable the students of our school to gain work experience in companies and organizations in Ireland and England. There will be 32 participants from the 2nd and 3rd year of study involved in this project. The participants will come from the four-year study courses focused on tourism, business, hospitality and engineering, and from the three-year vocational training branches machinist, toolmaker, mechanic and cook-waiter. Foreign work placements will be a part of the compulsory school practice. 30 mobilities will be 4 weeks long. 2 mobilities will be organized within ErasmusPro and will last for 3 months. 
The project aims to improve the quality of professional practice of students. We want the participants to have the opportunity to try out working in a real working environment on foreign workplaces, to apply here their theoretical knowledge and gain new expertise, skills and competencies. We want to strengthen the key competencies of participants and provide them with work experience. We also want to achieve the development of language, intercultural and social competences of the participants. Among objectives of the project belong, from the perspective of the school, to expand and deepen international cooperation, transfer new knowledge from abroad and use it to improve teaching quality. We want to gain new experience with the implementation of European projects, strengthen the prestige of the school, enrich the education of European dimension and attract new prospective students.
Participants will be placed in small and medium enterprises and organizations. Professional work tasks will be based on the relevant units of learning outcomes ECVET. Participants focused on tourism will work in facilities for tourists, such as museums, cultural institutions and monuments. Participants who attend Business College will spend their internship at administrative positions in companies and organizations. Participants focused on hotel industry will be working at receptions or as skilled gastronomy workers in hotels and other accommodation and catering facilities. Participants from mechanical engineering will work in the preparation of production (construction, technology, planning) or in manufacturing and its management. Participants of the field machinist, mechanic and toolmaker will work in engineering companies in qualified positions in preparation of the production, manufacturing, assembly and maintenance. Participants of the branch cook - waiter will work in hotels, restaurants and other catering establishments as a qualified workforce in Food and Beverage. 
Thanks to the project participants will gain new expertise, skills and competencies in their specialization and expand their professional qualification. The participants will develop their key competencies and improve their English. After placement they will receive the Europass-Mobility. This will allow them to evidence gained experience throughout the EU. Participation in the project will have major impact for participants´ professional career. It will facilitate their further studies and after graduation their labor market entry. The school will broaden and deepen cooperation with foreign partners. We will meet the current requirements of the practice in developed countries, and will bring the experience from abroad. The project will help us improve the quality of vocational education and contribute to the growth of the attractiveness of study at our school. Qualified workforce with a quality foreign practice and foreign language skills in the fields, where there is a lack of employees in our region (engineering, hospitality, and tourism) will be prepared for employers.
From a wider perspective, the project will contribute to the development of European cooperation in vocational education, improve the quality vocational training, improve the knowledge of foreign languages, support the development of key competencies, and promote intercultural awareness. Through the use of ECVET and Europass-Mobility the project will contribute to the development of transparency and recognition of qualifications within the EU.

We want to use the project as a tool to meet the objectives set out in the European Development Plan of our school. We want to provide our students with good work experience in foreign companies, to encourage the school to become more involved in European cooperation, to build the reputation of the school and to improve the quality of teaching. We want to use the experience gained from implementing previous mobility projects and build on their achievements.
The aim of the project is to bring participants new professional and linguistic knowledge, skills and experience and to contribute to the development of their key competencies. Participants are expected to expand expertise in their field, improve English and gain work experience. During the internship, the participants are expected to develop their personality, strengthen independence and self-confidence and their belonging to European culture. Mobility and the future employability of participants in the labor market will increase. The internship should be for participants also inspiration and motivation for further study and creative work. The aim of the project is also to transfer new ideas and methods and gain awareness of what is happening in the field in the European context. It is an important step towards establishing and developing cooperation between our school and foreign companies.
The project is intended for students of the 2nd and 3rd year of school. We will send 20 participants in total. Eighteen students of modelling and fashion design, interior design and multimedia will participate in 4 week internships in England, Ireland and Spain. Two third-year students with a focus on multimedia will take part in a three-month long-term internship in Ireland within ErasmusPro.
Internships will take place using the ECVET tool. Participants with focus on modelling and fashion design will work in boutiques, fashion shops, theatres and beauty salons. They will learn to work with different materials, try out new technological processes, will communicate with customers, will create designs, patterns and samples using specialized software and classic procedures. Participants focused on interior design will gain experience in design, graphics, kitchen, architectural and advertising studios. They will use art techniques and work with graphics software. Participants focused on multimedia will gain experience in graphic design and advertising studios, IT companies focused on web design and graphics, in film companies and marketing departments of companies. They will be trained in working with modern technologies in the field of ICT and graphical software.
The results of the project will be mainly in intangible form. This will be the acquired knowledge, skills and competencies of participants in vocational, language, intercultural and personal field. Material outputs will include, for example, created designs and participants' products, work diaries, participant´s report´s, photographs, articles, created units of learning outcomes ECVET and Europass - Mobility.
The internship will provide participants with a quality certified practice that will support them in further studies. After graduating from the school, it will be easier for participants to get a good job, or to get a good college. Thanks to the project, we will gain practical experience in European companies, get to know the current requirements of European employers and find out if our students meets the requirements. We will use the acquired knowledge to update the teaching of vocational subjects and English. The project will increase the prestige and reputation of our school, interest in studying at school and support artistic vocational education. The contribution of the project to increasing awareness of the Erasmus+ program and the European tools of Europass-Mobility and ECVET will also be significant. The long-term benefit of the project will be the fact that we will establish relationships with foreign companies and organizations that will allow us to continue to cooperate in the years to come, to maintain contact with European practice and to exchange experience.
Période de formation en milieu professionnel

We have noticed a real interest for international mobility from our pupils in our vocational school Le Likès. Many of them are willing to take part in a European program during their three- year -syllabus ( including a 22- week work placement over the period of three years ) in both industrial and commercial sectors. 

To fulfill that need, to valorize our courses, to develop team work among our teachers, to set our school in an international exchange process, to develop European citizenship among our youngsters and adults, to favour mind opening, LeLikès has to invest in an Erasmus+ program. 


Through past and present experiences, our school has developed skills and is getting better every year: we now know our needs and we can answer more precisely to our applicants'wishes. 

For the time being, our objective is to work on a two- year program in order to be coherent with our plan of action.New grants in 2015, in 2016 and then in 2017 have motivated and encouraged our teams. A new dynamic is blooming in our school.Even if it's difficult to find partnership and twinnings with other schools, our action is becoming more and more popular among colleagues who get involved in the projects and take part in actions such as selections, assessments and 

visits. We also share our experiences with colleagues from other sections of our school. New actors are getting involved in the project: we have contacts with an association in Quimper which will help us to find new partners so as to put an end to our collaboration with Avantages in Portsmouth, UK, and the Work Placement Agency in Dublin.  

These partnerships are efficient but have an important financial cost. That is the reason why we are starting to look for new partners in countries other than the UK, and under other forms ( partnerships, exchanges, etc. ). This will allow us to manage our funds in different ways by developping direct contacts and by offering a wider range of activities to our students. To illustrate this we are currently working with Roxana, a Romania European student who is spending a year in our school , to help us find new partners. 

To come back to our new application,we'll be working with the 1ères Bac Pro as usual. The beginning of the mobility will take place in September 2018 and our pupils will actually leave in May/June 2019. They will be trained for this mobility all through the schoolyear to insure the best possible integration  in their host families, in their work placement societies and perhaps school partnerships. 

The expected benefits of these mobilities are the following: 

Valuation of professional courses. 

Development of European citizenship 

Development of our pupils'professional skills 

Widen the number of applicants through testimonies of previous mobilities 

Development of team work among teachers 

Communication on our school international visibility. 

Federation of our educationnal community.

We want to realize the project in order to improve the quality of students' professional training,  in order to ensure the possibility to pass an internship in foreign companies and to develop existing and to establish new cooperation with foreign partners, to strengthen the prestige of schools and motivate young people to study technical disciplines.

From the point of view of the sending organization, the main objective of the project is to increase the quality of professional practices and to adapt the practical education of the participants to the needs of the labor market. From the point of view of the participants, the main objective of the project is to increase their employability in the labor market

The participants of the project will be students of the 4th year of secondary school for electrical engineering who will travel to Ireland and England for 3 weeks and students of the third year of higher vocational schools who will travel to Ireland for 14 weeks and will complete ErasmusPro mobility.

All foreign internships will be organized using ECVET. Participants will work in enterprises, the working tasks will match their study focus and units of learning outcomes.

As the project is mainly focused on the professional development of the participants, the results will be mainly intangible. The traineeship results will be the experience, knowledge, skills and competencies of the participants. The material outputs of the project will include Europass - Mobility, Certificates from Intermediary Organizations, ECVET form Placement Evaluation and Units of Learning Outcomes, photo-documentation from internships and articles on the Internet and in the press.

The project will have the greatest impact on participants. It will positively influence their further study, future position in the labor market and personal life. Thanks to their acquired experience, their employability, work mobility and practicability will be enhanced. 
The impact of the project on the school as a sending organization lies in establishing and developing cooperation with foreign partners and in getting incentives to enrich and modernize teaching.

The project will have a positive impact on the regional labor market. We will be able to offer employers graduates who meet their qualifications, professional experience and knowledge of foreign languages requirements.

We will contribute to deepening European cooperation, building partnerships, establishing new contacts and exchanging and transferring of experiences. We will support the development of mobility in the labor market, the growth of the employability of young people and the development of foreign language skills. By using the European tools Europass - Mobility and ECVET, we will support the transparency and recognition of vocational training.
Perspektiva pro budoucnost mladých techniků II.

The project "Future prospects for young technicians II" was developed on the base of defined needs of  Střední průmyslová škola Třebíč as a result of long-term cooperation with all partner organizations from Finland and Portugal. The latter partner acts  round the whole Europe and provides professional traineeships for us in Portugal, Latvia and Spain. We have recently selected a new partner in the UK.
The aim of the project is to increase the attractiveness of vocational technical education and training for students, to encourage participants in the acquisition and use of knowledge, skills and qualifications supporting personal development, employability and participation in the European labor market. The target group are  students of the Secondary Technical School in Třebíč. Opportunity to participate  in internships will be given to students from 2nd to 4th grade of maturita classes and students from 2nd and 3rd grade of apprenticeship. Within the two school years, we plan to implement 6 two-week internships for a total of 57 pupils + 6 accompanying teachers. We newly include ErasmusPro, a three-month practice for 15 third-year graduates. These internships include all study categories and subjects. In cooperation with partner organizations, we have created a preliminary plan - the date of the internship, the number of participants and the fields of study: Great Britain - autumn 2018 and 2019, 20 students in mechanical engineering, computer and control systems, autotronics, Portugal - 2 weeks, autumn 2019, a total of 10 students in the fields of energetics, computer and control systems, technical lyceum, electrician mechanic, mechanic adjuster, autotronics, miller, Spain - 2 weeks, autumn 2019, 10 students in technical lyceum, computer and control systems, electrician electrician mechanic, Finland - 2 weeks, spring 2020, total of 7 students in the fields of energetics, mechanical engineering, computer and control systems, technical lyceum, electrician mechanics,  Latvia - spring 2020, 10 students in engineering, technical lyceum, computer and control systems, electrician, three months ErasmusPro - mechanical and electrical engineering, Portugal, Spain, Great Britain, spring 2019 (9 students) and spring 2020 (6 students) . Participants will work in companies and professional training centres with regard to their specialization.
Students will be provided with the Unit of Learning Outcomes that they will fill during the internship and will be evaluated by the receiving organization.
The impact of the project is to improve participants' professional and linguistic competences and skills, awareness of multicultural society in Europe. The long-term benefit for students is the motivation for further study and interest in technical fields, increasing the overview of new trends in technical fields. An important long-term benefit is also the increasing prestige of the school.
The project results will be presented by participants at dissemination events.

When implementing the project, we want to send abroad 40 students and two graduates of our school during two years.
The participants of the project will be studets of third year and graduates of four-year-course, focusing on engineering and electrical engineering. The internships will take place in companies in England and Ireland. The traineeships of 3rd-year-pupils will last 4 weeks, ErasmusPro traineeships of school-leavers will last 3 months. Before going to an internship, participants will attend the preparatory courses at the school and also attend OLS preparation.
The project has more objectives, among the most important belong:
- Improving the quality of professional practical training,
- applying the European tools ECVET and Europass Mobility,
- getting impulses to modernize the teaching and equipment of the school,
- establishing and developing cooperation with foreign partners,
- improving the employability of participants, improving their communication skills in English, achieving personal and social development and enhancing their intercultural awareness
Participants will gain new professional competencies in their field, learn the workflow, get familiarized with the organization of work and integrate into a working team in a foreign company. They will work with modern technical equipment. The specific work tasks of each participant will depend on their field of studies. They will find use, for example, in the preparation of production - modeling using CAD systems, in production - working with NC and CNC machines, servicing and repairing of machines.

Thanks to staying abroad, participants will increase their mobility, adaptability, independence, and experience.

In order to ensure the standardized quality of the professional work content of the internships and the proven assessment of the professional outcomes of the internships, we will use the ECVET system.

The outputs of the project will be primarily in intangible form. These will be the competences and experience of project participants, the impact on the sending organization and its surroundings. Tangible outputs will include the Europass - Mobility, Certificates from foreign organizations, and ECVET Documentation - Units of learning outcomes and evaluation forms, photo-documentation from workplaces, articles in press media, and presentations about internships.

The school will establish and develop cooperation with foreign partners. There will be exchanges of experience and incentives to improve learning. Through the dissemination activities, the project will greatly enhance the building of the school's good name. We will get more pupils interested in attending our school and we will expand the cooperation of the school with the employers, which will help to increase the offer of technical educated staff.

The impact of the project lies in the promotion of technical education, adapting the content of education to the needs of practice, developing foreign language skills, increasing labor mobility, developing European cooperation and European eligibility of learning outcomes.

During 2 years we intent to send abroad for an internship 40 students of the Secondary Medical School in Turnov. Internships will take place in health and social care facilities in England and Ireland. Thirty-eight internships will last 4 weeks, two trainees will travel to pass 3-months-long ErasmusPro Mobility.
The participants of the project will be students of third year of four-years-course, specialized on medical lyceum, health assistant, social activity, or masseur.

Before going to the internship, all participants will attend preparatory classes and OLS preparation.
In the internship, the participants will acquire new professional competencies in their field: they will develop professional communication with staff, focus on the operation of facilities providing health / social care, practice acts related to care (e.g. hygiene, food, disinfection, sterilization, care about beds and  lingerie, preparation for examination, activation of clients, partnering, measurement of physiological functions - temperature, pressure, pulse and breath etc.) and will be familiar with the documentation related to care. Participants will gain experience that will help them in providing care to foreigners in the Czech Republic. By staying on an internship, participants will increase their mobility, adaptability, independence and experience.

We will use the ECVET tool to provide a standardized professional content of internships and to evaluate the professional outcomes of internships.

The project will meet more goals, the most important are:
- to improve the quality of professional training,
- to strengthen the European dimension of education and apply the European tools ECVET and Europass - Mobility,
- to establish and develop cooperation with foreign partners,
- to increase our students' readiness to enter the labor market - this is related to the improvement of the professional level, the acquisition of new knowledge and experience, familiarization with the standards and procedures for providing care in another EU country.
During the implementation of the project, the school will develop cooperation with foreign partners. There will be exchange of experience in health and social care.

Thanks to dissemination activities, the project will greatly enhance the reputation and awareness of the school. The school gets more pupils interested in studying, which will help to increase the supply of health-educated employees.

The outputs of the project will be primarily in intangible form. It will be about the acquired competencies and experience of the participants. Material outputs will include Europass - Mobility, Certificates from Foreign Organizations and ECVET Documentation - Unit of Learning Outcomes and Assessment Protocols, Photo documentation, Articles in the Press, and Presentations of Internships.

The impact of the project lies in supporting health and social education, transferring health and social care experience from abroad to the Czech Republic, developing foreign language skills, increasing labor mobility, developing European cooperation and European eligibility of learning outcomes.

This experience will help our students to know different working processes and cultural environment, they will improve their learning at a personal and professional level. They will improve their linguistic competence and gain experience in a different working environment. The I.e.s. Emilio Canalejo Olmeda was founded in 1968. The activity of the center not only reach the town of Montilla but it also has a very important regional dimension, providing a training and educational service to students in the south area of the city of Cordoba. The school is highly prestigious at a local and regional level because of its high rate of labor insertion, this is why our school receives students from other cities.

This project is adressed to VET learners that will undertake an internship abroad within their field of study. The purpose of this project is to strengthen the schools' cooperation with European organizations and ensure its sustainability. We also aim to create a framework where there is an exchange of good practice , mutual enrichment , and validation of competences and qualifications , while enhancing the presence and European dimension of our center.

There will be 16 ErasmusPro mobilities for students with the following training:
C.F.G.M. Technician in Olive oil and Wines, C.F.G.M. Technician in Administrative Management, C.F.G.M. Technician in Auto-body, C.F.G.M. Technician in Electromechanical of Vehicles, C.F.G.M. Technician in Electrical and Automatic Facilities.

In order to coordinate the programme, the school will work with intermediate organizations in Italy, UK and Portugal.
This experience will help our students to know different working processes and cultural environment, they will improve their training at a personal and professional level. They will improve their linguistic competence and gain experience in a different working environment. 
The expected long term impact and outcomes are:
- To improve our teaching/learning process
- To convey a European dimension and vision to our educational community
- To create closer ties between academic world and labour market
- To get competence and qualifications ackwoledged at a european level.
- To strengthen a europan network enriching partners and the educational activities

The project  "Apprenticeship in British restaurants" will be realized in the form of two-week training of 20 students of  our school of gastronomy in companies which deal with this branch  in England (Portsmouth).
The chosen partner in an organization which operates in education and professional development. It has a lot of experience in organizing international mobility of students, young workers, graduates, educators and teachers. 
The participants of the project are students at an early stage of vocational education, at the technical grade. The project answers the needs of  students and work market of Malopolska region: according to the employers’ organization young people who finish school have far too low professional experience. Our students mainly come from Nowy  Sącz and surrounding small villages, with quite high unemployment rate. Because of that there is a demand for self-employment – creating companies which offer attractive services. Chosen profile is  connected with the development of the region where tourism is dominating. Before the work placements students will be provided with the language cultural and pedagogical preparations and logistics support (journey, accommodation, local transport, tutoring). The training will be held in carefully selected companies according to profile and school curriculum for the given profession. The apprenticeship will be monitored by the representatives of ZSP and Partner. 

Additionally students will be supported by mentoring system to ensure the best quality of training.  During  work placements students will gain new professional skills connected with British gastronomy, work organisation, customer service, decoration and equipment in the kitchen, see ways of running companies and organization of service market. 
As a result students will be more open on new experience, aware of the need of lifelong learning. They will be more mobile on the European work market. Experience gained during work placement  will be valuable in the educational process in a Polish vocational school.
The project realizes the needs connected with the school curriculum and taking into consideration the demands of the changing market.

Objectives:
- two-week training abroad of 20 students of gastronomy profile in the UK,  
- participation in European mobility of students of early stage of vocational training, achieving documents which confirm gaining foreign professional experience, 
- developing theoretical and practical skills in a given job,
-introducing to the school training curriculum elements of British cuisine which can be implemented in our region, 
- developing professional English language skills,
-getting to know hosts’ culture and thanks to it supporting social cohesion and inter-cultural dialogue, showing mental and cultural differences,
- supporting personal development and adaptation abilities of the  youth coming from undeveloped regions of the south-eastern Poland.

As a result of the project we can expect: 
- getting Europass Mobility, ECVET certificates and other confirmations,
- completing school training,
- developing practical professional abilities of our students,
- the increase of the school prestige,
- participation in eTwinning project, 
-  developing professional activity of our graduates, who will have innovative professional abilities,  will be able to move on the European work market easily, know foreign languages, be creative, respect the rules of democracy and tolerance, be full of respect for others,
- the decline of the unemployment rate as a result of the increase of enterprises and self-employment, 
- the increase of the attractiveness of our region due to varied and professional gastronomic services. 
Duration: 17.09.2018-28.09.2018

IES Almunia offers Secondary Education (ESO) where curricular diversification programs are offered, Bachelor in Science and Technology specialization, Medium Cycle of Professional Training of "Microcomputer Systems and Networks" and Higher Cycle "Development of Multiplatform Applications", And Initial Professional Qualification Program (PCPI) of "Informatics and communications". Since 2004 we are ICT and DIG Center and since 2006-07 we are developing the "SPACE SCHOOL OF PEACE" project.

Since 2014 the center has presented mobility projects aimed at students of the Middle Degree to perform the FCT in an EU country. So far all projects are having a very high degree of student satisfaction.
This project is addressed to 10 students of our center who are studying the medium-level training cycle in "Microcomputer Systems and Networks" and "Commerce". They are between the ages of 17 and 25. They will carry out an internship in companies in Italy, Ireland and UK. All mobilities are ErasmusPro and will last 13 weeks.

The school will offer 5Job Shadowing mobilities to our VET teachers. They will stablish networks in innovative projects and start the internationalization strategy of the school.

The goals  set out in this project are:
- To promote training and innovation in our students.
- To Promote life lon learning which will have an impact on the quality of our academic offer.
- To Increase and optimize the use of ICT among our students.
- To train students in autonomy and entrepreneurship.
- To promote  responsibility as an individual, social and professional value
- To consolidate and extend in time agreements of collaboration and cooperation with European organizations in the field of training and labor entities that benefit a mutual enrichment both of our students and teaching staff, and consequently give a greater European dimension to our center.
- To improve the language competence of our students.
- To improve the climate of coexistence and avoid the high level of school absentesism.
- To reduce the percentage of students leaving the education system

Our school will work with intermediary organizations in Italy, Ireland and UK, they will be in charge of organizing and  monitoring the stays of the participants.

This is our fith project and aims to be a continuity in the mobility of our students. We believe that this project will be very positive for both students and teachers as well as for the center and the cooperation agreements that will consolidate in the near future, improving internationalization strategies, creating a common framework of qualifications, improving  our skills to prepare and implement European and international mobility projects.
We believe that with this project we will be able to create a network with European partners in which we can exchange good practices, improve and acquire innovative learning methods and processes.
PLUS-Mechatronics Ultimate Skills in Europe & SMART Specialisations

The project proposal PLUS-MUSE&SMART falls within the programming framework outlined in the Erasmus+ VET Mobility Charter obtained in 2016. The proposed project is in line with the Internationalization Strategy described in the Charter application, it further develops the experience made in 2017 and fully responds to the most recent labour market needs.  
The project is addressed to 100 participant, having obtained a VET school diploma for no longer than one year and residing in the province of Trentino in Italy. 
Project participants will have gained technical and professional skills during the school curriculum and have a profile that fits with a professional development in the SMART SPECIALIZATIONS fields. In the Province of Trento such fields have been identified with Agrifood, Quality of Life, Energy and Environment, Mechatronics. These sectors require good command of the following technologies: advanced manufacturing systems, biotechnologies, micro-nano technologies, ICT, advanced materials. The project is aimed at exploiting the learning opportunities offered by on-the-job training, in the form of a long-term workexperience. 
With a view to improve the whole local system approach towards on the job training, a mobility to the benefit of 8 members of staff involved in mobility and in dual training will be organised 
As regards the learners, the project will be not only aimed at reinforcing non-formal learning thanks to the opportunity to play an active role in a work context but also at improving their competencies and qualifications for better quality and faster job opportunities. The mobility learning outcomes will be tailored to the single participant and specialization sector in order to obtain a final certification of competence in the relevant sector. The potential companies where the workexperience will take place have already been pre-selected, in order to identify quality environments where the learning outcomes can reasonably be met. Along with the professional competencies, the mobilities will also be expected to improve participants’ linguistic and social competencies.  
Mobilities will take place in Germany, the UK, Ireland, Bulgaria and Spain, for 8 groups of 10/14 participants, with a duration of 12 weeks. 
The contents and the learning outcomes of the internships will be discussed with the companies and the participants. Participation to the PLUS-MUSE&SMART project will be based on a public open call for selections, with an application to be submitted by interested candidates.
Before the internship abroad, a preliminary linguistic, cultural and pedagogical preparation stage of 2 weeks will be carried out in Trento, to be financed with regional resources. The learners will also benefit from using the European OLS platform. The experience abroad will also include a 3-day initial induction and preparation to the workplacment. At the end of the experience abroad, 2 days of programme follow up will be organized in Trento. 
Upon return to Italy, a second workexperience of 8 weeks in Trentino will be available for the most technologically advanced sectors. This final stage will be entirely financed with regional resources. 
The project identifies specific quality tools which will be applied and combined in the tutoring, monitoring, and certification stage, both by the Sending and by Receiving organizations. 
As regards the 8 staff, a mobility of 4 days will be activated in collaboration with a German Partner Organization having the necessary requested experience. The programme will deepen cutting-edge tools, practices, methodologies and procedures, and will combine a theoretical component with practical observation one. The programme will be aimed at improving the competencies of the staff in managing and coordinating VET mobilities, and in enhancing the value of transnational mobility as a training tool.  
The whole PLUS-MUSE&SMART project will be accompanied by promotion, monitoring, evaluation and dissemination actions, to take place at the start, during and at the end of the project.

PARTICIPANTS IN THE PROJECT

For the activity A1 students of the 
- 12th and 13th class of the Business and administration section (professional), 
- 11th and 13th class  of the ICT and Computer technologies section (professional), 
can take part in an internship in companies located in France, Germany, Finland, the United Kingdom, Slovakia and Belgium or even in other European countries.

Activity A2 offers teachers the possibility to do a Job Shadowing in companies. This enables them to get a better view of what their students are doing during their internship and so they can adapt their courses to the real practice in companies. Teachers can hereby improve the quality of their lessons and update the information they are giving to students. This makes theory come closer to reality. 


PHILOSOPHY OF THE PROJECT

The huge demand in the labour market together with the growing internationalization of our national companies, make it very important for schools to promote European student exchanges to encourage their students to become more flexible and open-minded. 

With this project, these young people who will soon enter a labour market marked by a large and aggressive competition, are incited to try a new experience outside their familiar environment. Staying abroad on their own favours their personal development and makes them become more independent and self-confident. 

The fact of having been abroad for an internship can also be very profitable for the students in their further job application. They have to learn to work in a group and become a team-player; both qualities that are often demanded by employers. It shows employers that they are uncomplicated, committed and flexible.

The obtained competences and abilities are certified by a national certificate as well as by the delivery of the Europass- mobility.

Every partner for this project is also trying to
- organize cultural and social activities,
- organize visits of the regional area and its touristic attractions,
- organize meetings between the student’s school and the partner schools

The constant search of new partners for this project, as well as the close cooperation between schools and professional partners – as it is not only about the simple exchange of students for an internship - is another aim of this project and favours the collaboration between experts of the professional world and school.

AIMS OF THE PROJECT

The internship gives the students the possibility to
- improve their language skills,
- make them aware of the importance of practical experience and international flexibility in the pursuit of an employment,
- make them more flexible and open to the world,
- improve their team-spirit in an international working-environment
- discover other countries, languages, ways of life and culture,
- improve their communication skills and develop their personality,
- grow in experience.

WHEN DO THE EXCHANGES TAKE PLACE?

STUDENTS A1 (6 weeks): 
- 12th class of the Business and administration section (professional): January/February
- 13th class of the Business and administration section (professional): May/June , 
- 11th and 13th class of the ICT and Computer technologies section (professional) January/February, 

TEACHERS A2:
- Visit in autumn 2018 and 2019 to organize the activities of this project, 
- Job shadowing of companies where students are doing an internship,
- Meetings with other teachers of our partner schools in Halle, Lappeenranta, Strasbourg, Bastogne, Martigues, Presov,
- Meetings of the colleagues in charge of the radio LNW with other schools,
- Advanced training for the teachers of the wood department in Germany (2 days or 3 days),
- Advanced training for the members of the SePAS (former SPOS) in Germany,
- Job Shadowing in the partner companies of the aforementioned schools. 

ORGANISATION OF INTERNSHIPS FOR OUR PARTNER SCHOOLS

Every year, the coordinator of the LN organizes the internship for 10-12 students of our partner schools here in Wiltz.
Mobility v Európe - Aká Fantastická Skúsenosť!

In September 2018, forty students of the third and fourth grades will take part in their vocational training in the firms and companies in the Czech Republic (Olomouc), Malta, Great Britain (Southampton) and Croatia (Dakovo). The participants will be accompanied by six experienced teachers of our school who will act as their mentors as well.  The two above mentioned partners are our new partners  and the partners in Malta and the UK are our verified partners with whom we have already participated within Erasmus + and the collaboration has proved successful. By this project, we would like to support social inclusion and equality of the students from the least developed districts (according to the latest statistics, Lučenec, Poltár and Veľký Krtíš has belonged among the least developed districts over a long period). Our goal is to create opportunities for the personal growth of our students what would be long-lasting benefit for them because they would get a greater chance to succeed in international labor market as our region belongs to those of high unemployment rate. Our aim is systematic and long-lasting modernization of our school which would reflect the real needs of its students as well as the needs of the labor market. The internationalization is a must and it is necessary for VET. 
The main activities which were planned in the European Internationalization Strategy of our school will be implemented as follows:
• we have already modified the content of the Curriculum,
• the teachers of economic subjects will continue to learn English language to be able to implement planned job-shadowing in one of the partners´ countries,
• we will strengthen existing partnerships by means of mobilities and thanks to the eTwinning portal we have established new contacts with the partners in CZ (Olomouc Business Academy) and HR (Dakovo secondary school of economics),
• in September 2018, two teachers of economic subjects will take part in job shadowing (CZ, GB) which will strengthen developing of international cooperation of the partners, contribute to innovations in teaching and, last but not least, will make suggestions for further cooperation,
• we will continue to be the reciprocal partner for the students from CZ, HR, HU and FR,
• in October 2017, Ms E. Gálová participated in a 4-day seminar organized by the Polish NA (2017-TCA-009) which resulted in creating the new partnership for the future project KA229. Our school will apply for a grant and will be a coordinator. Affiliated partners will be the schools in Italy, Spain and Poland,
• on February 16, 2018, in collaboration with the Theater Center, our students will attend a theatre performance about the dangers of political extremism and in May 2018, an excursion to Osvienčim is arranged for the students of the 3rd grade,
• in December 2017, our school took the 3rd place in the Euroscola 2018 contest and on March 8, 2018, 24 pupils and 2 teachers are going to attend a working meeting in the European Parliament,
• in December 2017, the contest of English language as well as German language took place at our school. The winners successfully represented our school within the district contest on January 17th and 18th, 2018 and are going to represent our school at regional round on February 14th, 2018,
• within Erasmus + KA2 programme, we have been involved in the strategic partnership. The coordinator is secondary vocational school in Nový Jičín (2017-1-CZ01-KA202-035443).
After the discussion in the E + project team, there will be a fundamental change in the evaluation of the training during these mobilities. Each day a mentor from the receiving organization assigns points to a student to a rating table according to predefined criteria. During the last week of the internship, the students will make a PowerPoint presentation topic of which will be pre-specified by a mentor from the sending organization before leaving for mobilities. The last day of the mobility will be set for this presentation in front of a 3-member committee that will consist of a mentor from the receiving organization, a mentor from the sending organization and a legal  representative of the receiving organization. The average of the points from the rating table and the points gained for the presentation will result in to a final mark from the vocational training.  After coming back from mobilities, the sending organization will recognize the mark acquired abroad and will be listed on students´ half-year school reports. Additional value of the project will be viva voce of the presentation in English in Malta, the UK and Croatia.
European Mobility project for apprentices and young professionnals - Tour de France

The European Union is constantly moving forwards and the skills development of our European workers has become essential. Companies are now dealing with international exchanges and facing multinational competition. Qualifications and skills are therefore put into question. In order to contribute to this expansion, it is primordial to provide each apprentice with the possibility to be trained and to work on a European level. It is our duty to offer our learners such a training. Les Compagnons du Devoir have always given priority to a long life learning and make every effort to value on-the-job training and mobility, mainly through shared experiences, human relations and the sharing of knowledge. 

Long term mobility projects (1 year) have always existed in our association. Part of our “Tour de France” syllabus gives the opportunity for our journeymen and journeywomen to have a one-year work experience abroad. Since 2011, it has become compulsory and more than 6700 of our young professionals have benefitted from such an experience.

We have also had the opportunity to allow, since 2004, almost 16100 apprentices to benefit from a 3 week mobility project within the European Union, combining all trade sectors (industry, construction, baking, leather and textiles trades). 

In order to institutionalize our actions, we manage to officially integrate the 3 week mobility project in to the learning annex of the apprenticeship contract for all our level 4 apprentices since 2009. 

For 2018-2020, we would like to maintain this momentum and keep the objectives shared under our strategic development plan by sending again more than 1000 apprentices on group mobility projects together with their VET trainer (110 groups in total), 180 post-apprentices for a long term mobility (one year), 108 apprentices for 3-months to 9-months individual mobility –sharing time between a company and a VET center in the host country, 60 post-apprentices on 2-week technical training courses and manage two different job-shadowing.

To carry out these actions Les Compagnons du Devoir are continually aiming to improve and since 2016 we have put in place our own quality management processes developed through the ISO 9001 certification. 

The quality of our mobility projects relies greatly on the developed teaching skills of our partners, who suggest precise programs compatible with the apprentices’ syllabus in France and with the specificities of the host country. This approach guarantees the relevance of our programs and reassures the employers of our apprentices, who could be concerned about the benefit of a mobility outside France.
These projects will allow the participants to acquire language, intercultural and cross-disciplinary skills as apprenticeships and trades are different from one country to another. Travelling is also a way to develop adaptability and flexibility, two qualities required in the labor market. 

Our partners involved in these projects are VET centers, companies, social partners, consular chambers and intermediate organizations in over 20 countries. Mobility is more and more recognized in these countries, therefore most work placements will be renewed year after year. 
Years of experience with our partners allows us to organize our projects with mutual trust and better prepare each participant for their mobility.

Each participant’s skills and competences gained abroad will be validated by the European partner and the French VET trainer on our online training platform “Aquisav”. We also would like to use ECVET system. With this in mind, our partners have already signed the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU). 

As part of this project our International Department will maintain relationships with partners, prepare and coordinate the monitoring and the validation of each project. They will also help their VET centers, in France, with the practical organization of the mobility projects for apprentices (short-term and long-term) and support post-apprentices following technical training or going abroad for one year (individual mobility).

This ambitious project couldn’t be organized without the considerable investment of VET centers, in particular our VET trainers and administrative teams.

In Project ‘’  International experience for future opportunities in labor market’’ school year 2017./2018 international practice in modern Europe schools and companies will be done by 4 Kuldiga Technology and tourism technical school teachers and 34 students who will work in Germany , Sweden, Estonia, Italy, Finland,United Kingdom, Portugal and Slovakia . Jelgavas Amatu vidusskolas audzēkņu un pedagogu profesionālās kompetences pilnveide

The target group of the project is 14 pedagogues and 56 pupils from Jelgava Crafts Secondary School catering and restaurant services, production of flour products, hairdressers, costume design specialists, make-up artists, commercial sciences, metal working specialists. The project involves student mobility and the mobility of vocational education professionals.
The first project activity is student mobility, in which students will practice for 14 days in partner organizations in France, UK, Germany and Malta, 28 days in Italy and Spain, using OLS online language support.
The second project activity is the observation and exchange of experience of vocational education specialists:
In September 2018 and April 2019 PARAGON LIMITED;
In March 2019 TRIBEKA TRAINING;
In April 2019 IBD Solutions Limited Intermediary United Kingdom;
In May 2019 the Nanterre Institute of Hairdressing and Aesthetics, Marie Laurencin Secondary School, BTP CFA ILE DE FRANCE,
In May 2019 the vocational training center Agenzia per la Formazione in Italy, at the Fondazione Gabriele Castellini School in Italy.
In May 2019 Vitalis GmbH, Germany, acquires new teaching methods, practical skills, organization of an educational process based on the work environment, in order to ensure a qualitative learning process.
The objectives of the project are:
1. To promote vocational education and the attractiveness of vocational education.
2. Improvement of the professional knowledge of Jelgava Crafts Secondary School Practicum Heads and Professional Teachers, improvement of pedagogical skills and professional competence in the form of work monitoring that would promote improvement of professional education quality at Jelgava Crafts Secondary School (increased level of knowledge and skills and quality of study process, skills of new educational programs development).
3. Jelgava Craft Secondary School teachers' introduction to student placements in Spain, France, Italy, Germany, Great Britain and Malta.
4. A broader understanding of teachers about the use of various and innovative teaching methods, the organization of practical classes, the development of vocational education programs, catering and restaurant services, hairdressing services, beauty care services, tailor-made and metal-working training.
5. Teachers get an understanding of the organization of a work-based educational process.
6. To support and increase the ability of learners of chefs, waiters, confectioners, bakers and confectionery, costume designers, hairdressers, business people, metalworking specialists to acquire skills, skills and competences that will promote their personal growth, employment and opportunities to integrate into the work of Latvia and Europe. in the context of increased competition.
7. Catering and restaurant services in Spain, Italy, France, Germany, Great Britain and Malta. Commerce in Italy, acquisition of hairdressing services in France, Germany and Malta. Learn how to make sewing products in France, metalworking - in France, Germany and Malta.
8. Improved professional English, Italian and French proficiency for teachers and students and enhanced intercultural competences.
9. To improve the level of education of Jelgava Crafts Secondary School catering and restaurant services, production of flour products, hairdressing, costume designers, make-up artists, commercials, metalworking specialist pedagogues and students.
10. Encourage mobility of students and teachers.
11. Establishment and improvement of contact with municipalities, catering services of Spain, France, Italy, Germany, Great Britain and Malta, flour mills, hairdressing salons, sewing, marketing, metal processing companies.
The aim of student mobility is to help vocational education students learn their profession better by developing their professional skills, knowledge, skills and abilities, giving them access to new working methods in Spain, France, Italy, Germany, the UK and Malta. It will raise the level of students' knowledge and skills, will give students a better understanding of their profession. The acquired work experience will provide students with an important contribution to their personal growth.
Vocational education specialists and practitioners will improve their methodological knowledge in developing educational programs, conducting practical classes, organizing study work, and gaining an understanding of the organization of the educational process based on the work environment and on the educational system in Europe.

For fifty years, Remus Radulet Vocational College has carried out vocational training in Romanian, Hungarian and German mother tongues, (vocational secondary school and vocational school) in the field of automation, electrical engineering and mechatronics. The opportunities offered by mobilities of Erasmus +, using European instruments for professional skills acknowledgment, ECVET and Europass will change the perception towards education and professional training, will draw students to CTERR. The Leonardo da Vinci mobilities have increased the prestige of the school on on a local, regional,  national and international level. Through students’ and VET specialists’ mobilities, the education and professional training will aquire a bigger opening towards studying results, it will be more attractive, flexible and relevant. Moreover, the opportunity for social insertion will increase, both on a national and European level. Considering these objectives for the present application, according to VET Chart, we target two types of activities: 
VET-CHARTER-SHORT - Short term mobility of VET learners and VET-CHARTER-STA - Staff training abroad,  in four flows as follows:
For students and graduates:
1. VET learners traineeships in vocational institutes at Kossuth Lajos Technical College in Gyor, Hungary with a practice period in the company (10 students - 60 hours). The objective is acquiring new practical competences in carrying out electronic circuits, using an electronic platform NI ELVIS II, according to the curriculum for the XI-th grade, technician in automation and electrical engineering .  The practical activities last for 60 hours and focus on module ’Electronic circuits’. In those 60 hours which will be evaluated and validated as a period of initial training, the participants will develop main competence units: the identification of electronic circuit types, evaluating the performance of the electronic circuits, connecting electronic circuits in equipments and installations (according to SPP, Annex 4, OMENCS, 4121/13.06.2016, Automation and electrical power installation technician level 4. ). The students will obtain marks for module IX.
2. Training placement in a company having as main objective to facilitate students’ transfer from school to active life through work experience in National Instruments company from Debrecen (10 students – 90 hours). The work experience will be achieved according to the curriculum for the XI-th grade, Technician in automation, electrical engineering and mecatronics. The 90 hours of training will comprise: ‘Electronic circuits’ (66 hours), ‘Electric circuits’ (9 hours), ‘Measuring techniques in the field’ (15 hours).  The main training activities will be connected to  the electronic manufacturing process in electronics and automation. The participants will develop the following main relevant skills: identification of electronic circuit types, evaluating the performance of the electronic circuits, connecting electronic circuits in equipments and installations,  carrying out DC and AC circuits, using measurement techniques for determining and monitoring the technical data specific in industry  (according to SPP, Annex 4, OMENCS, 4121/13.06.2016, Automation and electrical power installation technician level 4).The training will be evaluated and validated  as a vocational training period. The students will obtain marks for this module.
3. Work placements of graduates at small and medium-sized entreprises coordinated by AVANTAGES  organization, Portsmouth, UK (10 graduates -120 hours). The objective is  the reinforcement of the vocational competences acquired in the initial training, through work experience. The 120 hour internship of the 10 graduates will familiarize them with the requirements of the British companies and labour market, acquiring new linguistic and intercultural competences.  AVANTAGES( partner in previous CTERR  projects) will create a bond between CTERR and the British employers, ensuring the mutual trust for both parties. The identified companies  receiving trainees would be: FI Electrical Services; DRB Electrical; Infonet Media; Camara Learning  LTD; 19 Computing; STML Energy Ltd; Nordiko Technical.
For staff:
1. Staff training abroad  through work two weeks, placement for 3 engineers teaching VET. The objective is learning innovative teaching approaches in VET subjects by acquiring work competences with NI equipment during 80 hours(two weeks) for 3 engineers at NI Debrecen, Hungary.
 The skills and competences acquired will be found in Europass Mobility for all the participants in the above mentioned mobilities.
CTERR  will continue the dissemination strategy and the efforts to attract graduates.  If the graduates will not be present at the selections , we will send students from the XI and XII grade in exchange. We presume that the majority of the  XIth graders from the target group will be underage believe that two flows will require an accompanying teacher.
